image.altText: Woman lying in curled up position on couch.

props.synopsis: The researchers hope their project can be used to build a profile of endometriosis sufferers.Â

image.altText: Two men sitting at an outdoor table in bushland

props.synopsis: Friends, family and strangers have travelled from across the country to help search for 23-year-old Hadi Nazari who's been missing since Boxing Day.

title.children: Friends and strangers rally to find hiker missing in Kosciuszko National Park

image.altText: a man appears relieved in his surf ski

image.altText: A woman in front of a horse yard fence pats a horse in the yard.

props.synopsis: Many lessons came from the 2003 Canberra firestorm, including how to better care for horses during a bushfire emergency. This summer, horse owners are being urged to have emergency safety plans in place for their animals.

title.children: During Canberra's firestorm, Jane protected horses. She wishes she hadn't

image.altText: Swimmers in water at Penrith Beach

props.synopsis: How hot is too hot? The answer, according to leading heat health experts, can change dramatically based on the complex interactions between environmental factors in different postcodes.

title.children: Heat risk is complex and your postcode could be the determining factor

image.altText: A man carries a bike through mid-shin deep water.

title.children: What does it take to finish the Hunt 1000 bikepacking adventure?

image.altText: CCTV screens set up at summernats 37

props.synopsis: With 130,000 people expected to come through the gates at Exhibition Park in Canberra in the next few days and 99 per cent of them expected to do the right thing, here's what goes into keeping an eye on the 1 per cent of "troublemakers".

title.children: 50 cameras, 40 staff watching for potential 'troublemakers' at Summernats

Awards season is kicking off in Los Angeles as the 82nd Golden Globes Awards gets underway, with TV and film stars rocking fancy frocks on the red carpet.Â

title.children: Magic Millions track potentially poisoned early last week, police say

image.altText: Yoon Suk Yeol stands behind a podium, speaking into a microphone, with two flags behind him

image.altText: A girl playing in a fountain on a water day

image.altText: Rear view of dad holding her little girl in his arms and looking at their house with installed solar panels.

image.altText: woman sitting at desk inside her catamaran

props.synopsis: Living aboard a boat has many advantages, offering residents a sense of community, security and a flexible lifestyle. For this reason, some women are giving up their homes on land to live on the water.

image.altText: Still taken from video filmed by man suspected of New Orleans attack.
